turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Do you have any theories about last night?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Theories?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: How Lucy and that guy got to the hospital. And all that damage at the school. The police are calling it a freak tornado. I'd like to interview you for the Daily- -

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I believe there's a rational explanation for everything. But I don't know what it is.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Can I quote you?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Where is your cousin Clark, by the way?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: He's off doing a top secret uh, investigation.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I knew it ! He's working on a  hot scoop !

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Gosh, what do you suppose .that is?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Well, Lucy, it's nice to see you're feeling better. Nice to meet you, Jimmy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Can I give you a lift?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Oh, no thanks.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It's no trouble. I'd like to ask you some more questions.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Someone's chasing him.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Say---you think that's the same guy who was in the accident with Lucy?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: The scoop of the year!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Oh, Jimmy, can't you forget about your career for one second?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: -- Planet. I mean, you were there. Do you think it was natural, or like some people are claiming, supernatural?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Jimmy, would you please put those poor flowers in water before they die?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Oh, sure.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I had to dump the papers in a trashcan. The Danvers have been arrested!

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I saw them dragged out of the Administration Building.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Did anybody notice you?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I can't help it if men notice me.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Lucy! Be serious. We could be executed for  treason!

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I sure wish Superman was around. He wouldn't let any of this go on. Not for one minute.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I wish they'd tell us what they're going to do with us.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I heard stories.  I don't think you wanna know.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I've been in love with you for years. Remember how you used to visit your sister in the newsroom? And put your fingerprints on my lens.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Remember? I was trying desperately to get you're attention.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You were? You mean we could've been... you-know-what... all this time?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: You bet your ass.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: You're supposed to guess.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: I am almost an adult. This is what I want.

turns.speaker: ZOR-EL
turns.text: But Kara, no one has ever gone from here to Earth. The journey is dangerous.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: It was my fault we lost the Power Source.

turns.speaker: ZOR-EL
turns.text: Years ago. And it was Zaltar who stole it.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: I allowed it to escape the City.

turns.speaker: ZOR-EL
turns.text: Superman will return it.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Why haven't you been able to contact him? He should have returned from the neutron galaxy ages ago. He may be dead. ZOR-EL But what can you, a mere girl-

turns.speaker: ZOR-EL
turns.text: Be brave, my .daughter. Be wise.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: As brave as my father. As wise.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: What are you making:

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: It's going to be a tree, I think.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: What's a tree?

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: It's something they have on Earth. You know, where your cousin went.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Where is Earth?

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Didn't you study six-dimensional geometry in school?

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Yes, I know the equations---I just can't see it in my head.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Even I have trouble with that sometimes. Earth is in outer space. And we're in inner space.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Wait till you're older. Here -- watch this.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: You see, a tree is a living thing.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Can you create life?

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: I'm sorry... I didn't know.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: It was my fault. You aren't old enough to use the wand. I shouldn't have given it to you.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I can do that.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: No sweat. When's the rest of your stuff arriving?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: There isn't any.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: This is all your clothes?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I have money to buy more, but I haven't had a chance since...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Since what?? Did you have a fire at your house or something?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I'd rather not talk about it.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: You're not...an orphan are you?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: My cousin Clark is my only relative on Earth.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Oh wow, I should've known. Me and my big mouth. Listen, you can borrow any of my clothes you want. Any time.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Thank you. You're very kind.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: She did that deliberately.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: She's a beast.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: How'd you do that?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Must've been a defective puck.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Keep an eye peeled for Myra. She's out to get you.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: But what for?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: She just hates anybody who isn't afraid of her.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Your hair looks the same.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: It was just a trim.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: No thanks. You go on.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Linda babes! There's this all-night party at Eddie's... his folks are away...

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Oh, I don't know. I'm not signed out for an overnight.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Go back, sign in, and climb out the bathroom window. McCloskey's always zonked out: she'll never hear you.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: It doesn't seem right.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Please, as a favour to me? So I won't  be the only girl?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Why is he acting so strangely?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I dunno, but he's gonna get creamed.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Lucy; come back!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Somebody's gotta do something!!

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I'm afraid I have some bad news about your car.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Mr. Danvers called. I'll get a new one with the insurance money. B.F.D.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Listen, I know I've been saying you ought party more, but keep your hands off this one, will yak? He's private property. I've been waiting years for him to develop.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: He's nice.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Nice? He's cute enough to melt lead!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: You're not gonna stay for the ice cream?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I have to get back. I'm having dinner with the Danvers.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Again? You're getting real tight with them. You're gonna be a straight-A student---just kidding, thanks for coming.

turns.speaker: MR. DANVERS
turns.text: Don't you believe in knocking?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Oh, yes. Knocking. The pre-entry signal. I forgot.

turns.speaker: MR. DANVERS
turns.text: What can I do for you?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I'm Linda Lee.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I mean, it would probably be there, if you received it.

turns.speaker: MR. DANVERS
turns.text: Here it is. Oh...of course. You're the orphan. I'm so sorry about your parents. We'll try to make you happy here.

turns.speaker: MR. DANVERS
turns.text: No plans for the weekend, Linda?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: No, MR. Danvers.

turns.speaker: MR. DANVERS
turns.text: Can't have you moping around the campus. Why don't you come home with us for dinner?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I'd love to.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Thank you both so much. It was a lovely lunch, Mrs. Danvers. I had a wonderful time. And you're a terrific chess player MR. Danvers.

turns.speaker: MR. DANVERS
turns.text: What? Me?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Sure. Mate in five moves.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: Cheer up, Nigel. It's not the end of the world.

turns.speaker: NIGEL
turns.text: It may well be. I know how you won that election Selena. You can't fool me.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: I have plans Nigel. You could come with me... I'm going places.

turns.speaker: NIGEL
turns.text: You're not going anywhere. Except back to nowheresville. You're too impatient, Selena. Look around you--all these people have served years and years of apprenticeship. Some of their families have been in the Craft for generations. You can't join and take over our whole organization in a few months.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: I just did. Because I have the Power.

turns.speaker: NIGEL
turns.text: You're going to pay a terrible price. The power of Shadow is tricky. Use it too much and it takes over.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: Bianca's taught me all! need to know. I'll be safe, as long as I don't go too far.

turns.speaker: NIGEL
turns.text: Cigarette?

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: Nigel, get out of here. And don't come slithering back. Nigel shakes his head.

turns.speaker: NIGEL
turns.text: You need me, Selena. I'm the only one who can save you from a terrible fate.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: I need you like an Eskimo needs a lawnmower. Now burn rubber.

turns.speaker: NIGEL
turns.text: Balefire on you, Selena!

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: You Scorpios can never take a joke.

turns.speaker: NIGEL
turns.text: You think you are on top now. Well there is someone coming to challenge you. I saw it in the cards this morning.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: Throw him out.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: Nigel, get lost.

turns.speaker: NIGEL
turns.text: I have to talk to you.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: You're wasting your breath.

turns.speaker: NIGEL
turns.text: You used to listen to me. When you asked me to teach you something of the Craft.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: I could teach you a thing or two now.

turns.speaker: NIGEL
turns.text: ...trust the wisdom of the ancients, trust the Great Mother to protect us... Why. are you staring at me like that?

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: I was just thinking, if I had your skin problems, I'd use a good tannisroot ointment. Every night.

turns.speaker: NIGEL
turns.text: Nothing's wrong with my skin.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: Such a shame. You ought to take better care of yourself.

turns.speaker: NIGEL
turns.text: You better have a pretty good explanation for this, Selena.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: We are in great danger. A being has come to Earth with powers far beyond those of anyone member of the Craft.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: Which of you is willing to make that sacrifice?

turns.speaker: NIGEL
turns.text: You would! You revealed our existence so you could have all of our power.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: Maybe you'd like to get rid of this Supergirl yourself, Nigel?

turns.speaker: NIGEL
turns.text: Why get rid of her at al1? You've used the Coffer of Shadow too much.  It is beginning to rule your heart.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: Nonsense.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: That was meant for me!

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Thank you. I'm going to close this up again.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Who are you ?

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: I am Selena. Give him to me. Now. Or you'll both be sorry.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: I don't scare that easily.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: That ought to keep you out of my hair for a while.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: A cheap trick.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Cheap but effective.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: The Danvers. And two of your little friends.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: It's just one more crime you'll have to pay for.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: You've run out of things to throw, Selena.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: I'm free. I can never thank you enough.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: Ever since I found that thing I've been like a prisoner in a terrible nightmare. You have no idea how awful it is to be mean all the time.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Your nightmares are over. I'm taking this back to Argo City where it won't be misused.  You could come too. It might be safer for you.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: What's it like?

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: It's the most beautiful place in the universe.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: Sounds O.K. to me. Let's go.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: Where is inner space?

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: It's everywhere. But water is always the door.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: They'll be grateful. If you hadn't found it, it would still be lost. Look, up ahead.

turns.speaker: SELENA
turns.text: Yes, I see it. Shining like a jewel.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: That's home.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: What is this place?

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: This is the Phantom Zone. But why did you come here from Argo City?

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: I was on Earth...

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Earth? You crossed the dimension barrier? By yourself?

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Yes. I went there to find the lost Power Source...

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Shouldnt've done that.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: ...but the person who has it. tricked me, and sent me to the Phantom Zone.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: It's dangerous to use a Power Source on Earth. It can unleash all sorts of terrible forces---

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Well, nothing we can do about it. Come into my house. You can stay with me, until I build you your own place. I expect you won't want to mix with the others-- not our type of people.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Others?

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Criminals.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: ...mid pleasures and palaces though I may roam..."

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: What? Palace? Hardly.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Just feels, a little, like a tiny bit of Argo City...

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: It's lovely. . .

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: No, no. Not lovely. 'Perfect'. Did everything just right. Nobody telling you to change this, move that around. Please yourself. That's the secret of happiness.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Are you happy, Zaltar?

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: What kind of a question is that? Of course: I am. I do whatever I want. All the time.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: But what about other people? Don't you miss them?

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: You look at them? How?

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: The Phantom Zone overlooks everywhere.. If you have the right tools.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: That horrible woman!

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Told you. Wouldn't listen to me. Knew it would make you sad.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Zaltar, please help me.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Of course, my dear. What can I do?

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Help me to get back to Earth. Where my friends are. They need me.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: There's no way out of the Zone. No one's ever escaped. That's why they send the criminals here.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: If there's a way in, there must be a way out.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: No, that's not true---there's well...no--

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: There is a way.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: I knew it!

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: But it's impossible.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: No, it wouldn't work, you couldn't, it's too--- if it didn't work you'd be swept into a singularity--- no, you'd never make it. Forget I mentioned it.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Then teach me how.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: No, it's no good---you can't practice--- you only get one go. A thing like that. No. Sure you don't want a sip of this? It's delicious, I think.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Takes a long time, you know, learning the wand. Just begun to understand it myse1f. Give things a kind of life--can also take away life; works backwards too. Besides I can't let you take my wand. Only have the one, what would I do? I'd be helpless. It's out of the question.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Then come with me.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Leave the zone? What would I do on Earth?

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: You could do anything. You could sculpt mountain ranges...draw with rainbows! You'd have superpowers.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Superpowers. Got you in a lot of trouble, didn't they?

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Please. I have to get back to Earth. My friends are in trouble. And unless I bring back the Power Source, Argo City will die.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: You're going to take me back?

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Going to try. Didn't say I could.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: I heard my mother ask you once "how could a man with such a selfish heart create beauty?" She was wrong, Zaltar, you have a generous heart.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Not doing this for you. Just sick of this place, that's all. Wretched singing sculptures, always yowling at you. Boring!

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: You can use the wand.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Better than when I was a child.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: What's that? Never saw anything like that.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Don't stop. Keep moving.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Yes, mustn't stop.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: It's Selena. I'm getting so I can recognise her work.

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Zaltar. Use the wand!

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Too late. Too late. Save yourself.

turns.speaker: ZALTAR
turns.text: Goodbye...

turns.speaker: SUPERGIRL
turns.text: Zaltar!

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Yeah? What do you want?

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Buddy, are we in trouble.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: First the supplier couldn't find the invoice. Then the order came up short. Then I missed the four o'clock plane from Cleveland and had to rent a car, and then I got a darn flat tire on the highway! Can you beat it? Boy, your boss must've been furious when I didn't show up by the end of the day today, huh?

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: What are you talkin' about?

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Good lord, fella! I'm talking about your boss.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Mr. Roebush?

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Roebush! That's  the guy! Buddy, he's gonna nail our behinds to the wall! this is Special Order! He said he had to have it before...  Omigod!! What's tomorrow?

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Tuesday.

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: TUESDAY! I got to get it all set up in his office tonight before all those big shots come here tomorrow for the meeting!!

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: S'not bad, s'very good, but... y'know what's wrong with this... Singapore...thing?

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Sling. Singapore Sling. What's wrong?

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Not enough vodka in it.

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: There's no vodka in it.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Aha! What'd I tell ya!

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: What? What did you tell me?

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Got vodka in it now. Gotta give it a new name. Hey, listen, you thought it up, we'll name it after you. What's your name?

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Brad.

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Brad is not a good name for a cocktail.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Hey! Y'know what they used to call me in high school?

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Brad?

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: No, no, on the football field. They called me...  ...The Smallville Flash.

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Hey, man, that's a great name for a cocktail!

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Man, you don't never pass out, do ya?

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Nope.  Never.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Here I am, honey, and I'm all yours.  Remember when you were Queen of the Prom? All the guys had to wait in line to get a dance.  But now there's only one name on your dance card, sweet thing, and it's --

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Brad Wilson.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Hiya, Kent, long time no see. Not that you ever could.  "See" I mean,  Hahaha!

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Hiya, sweet thing.  Little guy's getting' hassled, huh?  Kent, you still here?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I seem to be.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: All the kid needs is a couple of pointers from the ol' champ here.  Kent, I bet you didn't know I won the all-country bowling trophy two years in a row.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Uh, no, I didn't know that, Brad.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: A natural athlete can play any sport. Any sport.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Say, Brad. I think he'll be better off doing it his way.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: For a guy who was lucky to be water-boy on the high school team, you sure got a big mouth, Kent.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I just think Ricky would rather not get a bowling lesson in front of the other kids.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: The kid needs a man to show him --

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: The kid will do fine on his own.  Give it your best shot, Ricky!

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Lana Lang. How great to see you.

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: Clark.

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: You look wonderful.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: You always did.  Can I give you a hand with that?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: You shouldn't say that, you're the chairman --  ...uh, chairperson...

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: And here I am, just standing here. That's terrible. Thank you.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: You're welcome...??

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: For reminding me, I mean. Can you follow me?

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: I can't  Clark already asked me.  Didn't you?  He used to love this song.  Didn't you?  So he just said --  "Would you dance with me?"

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Sure, Lana, I'd love to.

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: You'd be surprised how many offers I didn't get. Even Brad wouldn't stick around for this.  It really isn't easy.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: The streamers? They're no problem, you just pull on them and --

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: And three years after the Royal Wedding, the King abdicated.  Isn't that terrible?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: It sure is.

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: There must be a gallon of potato salad left over.

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: You know what's the problem?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Too much mayonnaise?

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: Mayonnaise? Donald loved mayonnaise. Why would you think that was the problem.?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I didn't --

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: No, the problem is --  Why do I stay in Smallville? Believe me, I've asked myself the same question. Do you know how lucky you are to live in Metropolis?  The Big Apricot.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: But Lana, you could --

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: That's easy to say. But how? And what about Ricky?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: Ricky. My little boy. At least here we've got a house. and I've got a job. Okay, I'm only a secretary, oaky, but it pays the bills. Except for last winter when the fuel bills kept going up and up and up.  I even had to pawn my diamond ring then.

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: You...um...you never got married?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Oh...I came close once.

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: That song. I remember one day I came into the music room and you were fooling around at the piano. And I thought -- what am I going to do with all this potato salad?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: You thought that?

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: I thought "Clark Kent has a really nice voice." You didn't even know I was there.

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: I just can't stand this.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Hey, he'll be all right. Believe me Lana, I know. I was a late bloomer myself.

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: It isn't only that he's small for his age. how would you like to be the only kid in town without a father?  Look at him, he's stewed to the gills in the middle of the afternoon.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: But all he had was chocolate milk.

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: I mean him.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Gee, I haven't done this in years.

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: Some people don't think it's healthy.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Well, it's true you have to be careful things don't spoil, especially with mayonnaise or cream.

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: Clark, I think you worry too much about mayonnaise.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Me??

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: I'm talking about salt.  Oh, go ahead, pour it on, relax. That's what picnics are for.

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: And even nicer when there's a man around, Which isn't all that often.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: There's a lot of choices here.

turns.speaker: LANA
turns.text: No, all the good ones are married. That's why Brad thinks he's God's gift to women. This woman anyway. He's single. He won't take no for an answer, but he's the only one who's asking. And he knows it.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I meant all the choices here. All this --  -- cole slaw, guacamole --  This is some picnic!
